one_reviews_text: I have a problem and it is that the subtitles in the pcvr version come out so low that I don't see them... any solution?? in the quest2 version it doesn't happen to me...
review_feedback: Which subtitles are you using? Do you have a screenshot that you can drop on our discord channel for Exorcist?  www.exorcistlegion.com

one_reviews_text: i was very scared they did a very good job making it very scary and the end fight was very fun this is a very good game and if you have not played or downloaded it yoet tou should as soon as possible

I gave this game 5/5 based on the fact that's its truly TERRIFYING. As a horror game it deserves 5/5 because it's so HORRIFYING. It's honestly an extremely scary experience. As a game overall its probably 4/5 - but as a HORROR game I gave it a 5 because its so freaking scary.

review_title: Enjoyable game but can be buggy
one_reviews_text:
I am a fan of these short horror games that have good environments and a story to go with it, and this game is one of them. 

Some of the events in game actually gave me chills and the story had roped me in. However, I personally have experienced game breaking bugs that almost ruin the game for me. 

All in all I have enjoyed the game, but I just wish it went smoothly, so it would not lose the spark it has whilst playing through the chapters for the first time.

My main concern for the game is its length. I was able to 100% it in about 2 hours or less. And I wasn't rushing. I have to admit I was kind of disappointed at the end, and even the extra achievements didn't really add too much, especially in terms of rewards. But besides that, the game was good. It could be scarier, but that may be because I play a lot of scary games. But just be warned, if your looking for a long experience or something with some replay value, look elsewhere. If you want a quick, scary, one-off adventure, then go ahead. The game definitely had its moments, but unfortunatley didn't give me quite the scare (or length) i was looking for
frame rate is bloody awful using oculus link but have no other issues with other games so shouldnt be with this. Have above the reccomended specs.

wasnt scared....u dont really have to do anything....just walking around searchin the hints to trigger the  "story"

"One of the most scary games for VR"?  - NEVER!

I have loads of head room, Pos something to do with the Unity... shame cos this looked like it was going to be good. Also no in game graphic options, 
i7700 non k
1060gtx
16gb RAM
review_feedback: You shouldn't have any performance issues whatsoever at these specs. We'd love to help you figure it out.  Assume you're playing on Rift S (and not Oculus Link).

one_reviews_text: i got the game looking to be scared and it wont even load i uninstalled twice and all i see when i startup the game  is black

Pros: One of the most scary games for VR! Should include diapers.

Cons: The only issue I've face is the collision detection system. Sometimes you can go through objects, sometimes you get stuck in objects, and most severly you can go through objects and get stuck in a black screen (with no warning), in which case you need to restart the level.

A game that solves this collision issue reasonably well is Arizona Sunshine.

Too scared at points so it did its job and it did it well. I would describe gameplay mechanics but doing so would ruin the expereince.  Just know that it earned how much I paid for it, way scarier than any movie I've seen.

To explain the experience, this game is a different kind of scary. This is a "You can defend yourself" type of horror game, and although you are fully capable of doing so, you will NEVER feel in control due the atmosphere, not the mechanics themselves. It also DOES NOT rely on jumpscares (although few are present) and instead opts to fill you with dread. Then terror to make your heartrate spike. And then just more dread as you wait for the inevitable terror to begin anew. 

Most scared I've ever been, 10/10 for what they were aiming for, 8/10 as a game in general, 3 hours playtime for not 100% with replay. 

Just dig deep and push through.

It's an ok scary game to play. I felt like the first level was the scariest if I had to choose. The other levels didn't give me any reactions or feelings. I feel like the levels could be longer as well. I wish they would've added a sprint, to get by some of the boring parts a little quicker. I guess they didn't add one to make you feel more scared from only being able to walk slowly. I get that but still, a sprint would've sped up some parts for me where I was almost yawning.
This game was extremely well done, very enjoyable. I liked the aspect of being able to use exorcist tools inside of the game. 10/10.
I think I peed a little.

Lot of find stuff to solve puzzles. Graphics too slow on turns feels like a slide show. Just nothing really exciting happening or any tension. Just walk around finding stuff, which triggers next step.  Re7 still greatest vr game to date/ yet developers think they can get away with crap telportaton or annoyingly slow transition graphics.
review_feedback: Hi Dyinggone-  we urge you to look at the in-game settings where you can turn on free motion, free turning, etc. You're actually offered a large variety of locomotion choices from within the menu  in addition to language settings, objective interactivity, control mapping, etc.
